member.name: T:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.EnumSplitStyle
member.summary: Indicates how capitalizes words in a split enum name.

members.member: "DaysActiveInNewsgroup" gets converted to "days active in newsgroup", for example.
"DaysActiveInNewsgroup" gets converted to "Days Active In Newsgroup", for example.
"DaysActiveInNewsgroup" gets converted to "Days active in newsgroup", for example.

member.summary: Splits words in an enum name.
member.param: Enum name that needs to be split.
Indicates how the split words will be capitalized.
member.returns: with separated words.
member.remarks: This method inserts a space before each upper-case letter in . If is AllWordsStartLowerCase, for example, the name "DaysActiveInNewsgroup" gets converted to "days active in newsgroup".

member.name: T:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.BinaryHeap`2
member.summary:
Represents a binary heap.
The heap stores zero or more items, each of which has a unique key and a value that corresponds to the key. The items are ordered by value. The order can be either descending (for a max heap) or ascending (for a min heap), depending on the IComparer interface passed to the constructor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.BinaryHeap`2.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{`1})
member.overloads: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a default initial capacity.
member.param: IComparer interface for comparing values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.BinaryHeap`2.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{`1})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified initial capacity.
member.param: Initial capacity. Must be non-negative.
IComparer interface for comparing values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.BinaryHeap`2.Add(`0,`1)
member.summary: Adds an item to the binary heap.
member.param: The item's unique key.
The item's value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.BinaryHeap`2.TryGetTop(Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.BinaryHeapItem{`0,`1}@)
member.summary: Attempts to get the item at the top of the binary heap without removing it.
member.param: Where the top item gets stored if true is returned.
member.returns: true if the binary heap has a top item, false if the binary heap is empty.
member.remarks: The top item is either the largest or smallest item in the heap, depending on the IComparer interface passed to the constructor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.BinaryHeap`2.RemoveTop
member.summary: Removes the item at the top of the binary heap.
member.returns: The item at the top of the heap, as a .
member.remarks:
The returned item is either the largest or smallest item in the heap, depending on the IComparer interface passed to the constructor.
An exception is thrown if the binary heap is empty.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.BinaryHeap`2.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes a specified item from the binary heap.
member.param: The unique key of the item to remove.
member.remarks: If the item doesn't exist, this method does nothing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.BinaryHeap`2.UpdateValue(`0,`1)
member.summary: Updates the value of an existing item in the binary heap.
member.param: The existing item's key.
The item's new value.
member.remarks: An exception is thrown if the item doesn't exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.BinaryHeap`2.Clear
member.summary: Removes all items from the binary heap.

member.summary: Gets the index of an existing item in the binary heap.
member.param: The existing item's key.
Name of the calling method.
member.returns: The index of the specified item.
member.remarks: An exception is thrown if the item doesn't exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.BinaryHeap`2.AssertValid
member.summary: Asserts if the object is in an invalid state. Debug-only.

members.member: List of items in the heap.
The key is the BinaryHeapItem.Key and the value is the BinaryHeapItem's index within m_oItems. This is used to update an item's value without having to do a linear search for the item.

member.summary: Gets the number of items in the binary heap.
member.value: The number of items in the heap, as an Int32.

member.value: The full name of this class, suitable for use in error messages.

member.summary: Fills the interior of a rectangle that will contain text.
member.param: Object to draw on.
Rectangle to draw on. If empty, this method does nothing.
true if the text is selected.
member.remarks: This method fills the interior of a rectangle with either the system window or system highlight color, depending on whether the text is selected. Call this method before you draw the text. When you draw the text, use SystemBrushes.HighlightText or SystemBrushes.WindowText as the text color.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.GraphicsUtil.RectangleFToRectangle(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a RectangleF to a Rectangle.
member.param: Rectangle to convert.
Width of the pen that will be used to draw the rectangle.
member.returns: Converted rectangle.
member.remarks:
This method converts a floating-point RectangleF to an integer Rectangle, compensating for some GDI oddities in the process.
If precise rectangle drawing is required, the caller should convert all RectangleF objects to Rectangles using this method, then use the Graphics.DrawRectangle(Pen, Rectangle) method to draw them. The floating-point version of Graphics.DrawRectangle() should not be used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.GraphicsUtil.SaveHighQualityImage(System.Drawing.Image,System.String,System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Saves an Image object to a specified file in a specified format using high quality settings.
member.param: Image to save.
Full path of the file to save to.
File format.
member.remarks: Use this instead of Image.Save(filename, format) if you want a high- quality image.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.GraphicsUtil.SaveJpegImage(System.Drawing.Image,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves an image to a JPEG file with a specified quality level.
member.param: Image to save.
Full path of the file to save to.
Quality level to use. I THINK this can be from 1 to 100; the documentation is not clear.
member.remarks: Image.Save(..., ImageFormat.Jpeg) uses a low quality by default. This method allows the quality to be specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.GraphicsUtil.DrawErrorStringOnGraphics(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.String)
member.summary: Draws an error string on a Graphics object.
member.param: Object to draw on.
Rectangle to draw on.
String to draw.
member.remarks: This can be used to draw error strings on bitmaps in a uniform manner.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.GraphicsUtil.GetImageCodecInfoForMimeType(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the ImageCodecInfo object for a specified MIME type.
member.param: MIME type.
member.remarks: An exception is thrown if the requested object isn't found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.GraphicsUtil.ConvertPixelsAndPoints(System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Converts a height and width from pixels to points, or vice versa.
member.param: true to convert pixels to points, false to convert points to pixels.
Object that will do the conversion.
Input width. Must be greater than or equal to zero.
Input height. Must be greater than or equal to zero.
Where the converted width gets stored.
Where the converted height gets stored.

member.remarks: If isn't null, this method calls the Dispose method on , then sets it to null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.ColorUtil
member.summary: Utility methods for working with colors.
member.remarks:
This class adds functionality to the System.Drawing.Color class. A better design would have a new ColorPlus class inherit from Color, with new methods added to ColorPlus, but because the Color class is sealed, that isn't possible.
All methods are static.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.ColorUtil.RgbToHsb(System.Drawing.Color,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Converts a Color object to the HSB color space.
member.param: RGB color to convert to HSB.
Where the hue component gets stored, in degrees. Ranges from 0 to 360.
Where the saturation component gets stored. Ranges from 0 to 1.0, where 0 is grayscale and 1.0 is the most saturated.
Where the brightness component gets stored. Ranges from 0 to 1.0, where 0 represents black and 1.0 represents white.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.ColorUtil.HsbToRgb(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Converts an HSB color to an RGB Color object.
member.param: Hue component, in degrees. Ranges from 0 to 360.
Saturation component. Ranges from 0 to 1.0, where 0 is grayscale and 1.0 is the most saturated.
Brightness component. Ranges from 0 to 1.0, where 0 represents black and 1.0 represents white.
member.returns: RGB Color object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.ColorUtil.SetBrightness(System.Drawing.Color,System.Single)
member.summary: Modifies the brightness of an RGB Color object without affecting the hue or saturation.
member.param: RGB color to set the brightness for.
Brightness to set oColor to. Ranges from 0 to 1.0, where 0 represents black and 1.0 represents white.
member.returns: Copy of with modified brightness.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.ColorUtil.ColorRGBToHLS(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Windows API, converts an RGB color to the HLS color space.
member.param: RGB color to convert to HLS.
Where the hue component gets stored, in degrees. Ranges from 0 to 240.
Where the luminance component gets stored. Ranges from 0 to 240, where 0 represents black and 240 represents white.
Where the saturation component gets stored. Ranges from 0 to 240, where 0 is grayscale and 240 is the most saturated.
member.remarks: Note the parameter order, which corresponds to H-B-S, not H-S-B.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.GraphicsLib.ColorUtil.ColorHLSToRGB(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Windows API, converts an HLS color to the RGB color space.
member.param: Hue component. Ranges from 0 to 240.
Luminance component. Ranges from 0 to 240, where 0 represents black and 240 represents white.
Saturation component. Ranges from 0 to 240, where 0 is grayscale and 240 is the most saturated.
member.returns: RGB color.
